paragraphs.content: Psalm 139
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 139

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.

paragraphs.content: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

paragraphs.content: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

paragraphs.content: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O Lord, thou knowest it altogether.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

paragraphs.content: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

paragraphs.content: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

paragraphs.content: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

paragraphs.content: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

paragraphs.content: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

paragraphs.content: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

paragraphs.content: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

paragraphs.content: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

paragraphs.content: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

paragraphs.content: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

paragraphs.content: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

paragraphs.content: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!
paragraphs.contentHtml: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

paragraphs.content: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

paragraphs.content: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

paragraphs.content: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

paragraphs.content: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

paragraphs.content: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

paragraphs.content: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

paragraphs.content: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
